interestingFact: Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest rainforest in the world.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, the last remaining ancient wonder.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system.
India is the world’s largest democracy.
The Eiffel Tower can grow up to 15 cm taller in the summer due to heat expansion.
Kenya is famous for its wildlife safaris and the Great Migration.
Russia spans 11 time zones, more than any other country.
Rome is home to Vatican City, the world’s smallest independent country.
South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
